page.title: 16THE MUSKETT DUO (continued)
page.content: Michael and Doreen Muskett started collecting instruments in 1970. Their collection now contains about 300 items. Many of their instruments are wind instruments, but they also specialise in the Hurdy-Gurdy and they also teach people to play this unusual instrument. In their concerts they try to make the sounds as they would have been at the time when the music was written. They also have a harpsichord as this is a much older instrument than the piano. They perform concerts all over Britain. They particularly enjoy working with children, but they perform regularly at the London South Bank Festival and have performed on radio and television. They have also undertaken tours of France, Germany and the U.S.A.
